attributes.logicalName: Approval Of Credit Risk Transfer By Supervisor Of Pool Originator Flag
attributes.gcd: This column stores a flag to indicate that the supervisor of the originating bank, has given an approval that this pool meets the criteria of significant credit risk transfer. A value of Y indicates supervisory approval is provided, and the bank can treat any exposure to this pool as per the significant credit risk transfer guideline.
Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.

This column indicates that the underlying pool and the securitized exposures are being put beyond the reach of the originator institution and its creditors, including in bankruptcy and receivership which shall be supported by the opinion of qualified legal counsel and the securities issued do not represent payment obligations of the originator institution. A value of Y indicates that this criteria is met and a value of N indicates that this is not met. In the case of EU Jurisdiction, this is required to be complied with for the eligibility of treatment of originator to exclude securitized exposures in the RWA calculations.

Indicates whether the transaction is pertaining to that of a covered fund or not. A covered fund is a fund, which is detailed in the Section 619 of the Dodd Frank Act. 
As per Volcker rule, the term ‘‘covered fund’’ specifies the types of entities to which the prohibition contained in ll.10,a, applies, unless the activity is specifically permitted under an available exemption contained in subpart C of the final rule.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.

Flag indicates whether the given dimension value record has been disabled or expired. The list of values includes Y- Indicates that the dimension value has been disabled, N- Indicates that the dimension value is not disabled and is still active.

This column stores a flag to indicate that the originator institution does not maintain effective or indirect control over the transferred exposures. An originator shall be considered to have maintained effective control over the transferred exposures if it has the right to repurchase from the transferee the previously transferred exposures in order to realize their benefits or if it is obligated to re-assume transferred risk. The originator institutions retention of servicing rights or obligations in respect of the exposures shall not of itself constitute indirect control of the exposures. A value of Y indicates originator institution maintains effective or indirect control over the transferred exposures and a value of N indicates originator institution does not maintain effective or indirect control over the transferred exposures. In the case of EU Jurisdiction, this is required to be complied with for the eligibility of treatment of originator to exclude securitized exposures for the RWA calculation.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.
This column stores the date on which Securitization originated.
Refers to the description of securitization pool.

Unique identifier of the organization defined codes for a securitization pool. Securitize refers to a pooled group of financial assets that together create a new security, which is then marketed and sold to investors. The value and cash flows of the new security are based off of the underlying value and cash flows of the assets used in the securitization process. Companies will securitize illiquid assets into liquid assets in order to increase their overall liquidity and generate immediate proceeds from their assets.
Refers to the equivalent numeric identifier of the Securitization Pool Numeric Identifier.
Refers to the Unique Id for the Securitization pool type.

This column indicates whether Securitate is Self securitisation or not. Per the definition reporting bank is the Originator. For Example, as per definition given by APRA guidelines- Bank is the Originator of Internal Securitisation, and buys 100 percent of tranched exposures created. The underlying Assets of the sec pool are also retained on banks balance sheet and not derecognised. Per APRA this type of securitisation is done solely for the purpose of using the asset backed tranched securities created as collateral in order to obtain funding via a repurchase agreement with the RBA. The list of values are
Y,N.

governance.dqDesc: Should have list of values as N,Y
governance.dqType: List of Values or Code Check
